data.title: Grammy Award for Best Choral Performance
data.text:
Year Recipient(s) Work Performing artist(s) Nominees

Performing artist(s) in parentheses Ref. 1961 Thomas Beecham (conductor) Handel: Messiah Royal Philharmonic Orchestra & Chorus

Verdi: Requiem (Vienna Philharmonic Society of Friends and Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra)

Vaughan Williams: Mass In G Minor/Bach: Christ Lay In The Bonds Of Death (Roger Wagner Chorale)

Charles Munch – Berlioz: Requiem (New England Conservatory Chorus)

Bach: Motet No. 3 (Jesu Meine Freude) (Robert Shaw Chorale)

Arias, Anthems and Chorales of American Moravians, Vol. 1 (Moravian Festival Chorus)

[1] 1962 Robert Shaw (choir director) Bach: B Minor Mass Robert Shaw Orchestra & Chorale

F. Austin Walter, director; Eugene Ormandy, conductor – Walton: Belshazzar's Feast (Rutgers University Choir and Philadelphia Orchestra)
